author: Dimple Singh
title: Delhi-NCR weather forecast and warning by IMD: Sudden change in weather; rain, gusty winds lash region, IMD says more showers likely | India News - News9live
text: New Delhi: The national capital Delhi and NCR witnessed a sudden change in the weather on Friday night. Gusty winds coupled with rain lashed several parts of the Delhi-NCR, providing relief from the scorching heat. Lightening also struck several areas in Delhi-NCR. According to India Meteorological Department (IMD), gusty winds at 10 pm were reported in several areas of Delhi. In Ujwa, speed of the wind was recorded at 77 kmph, Jafarpur at 57 kmph, Lodhi road at 61 kmph, Pragati Maidan at 63 kmph, Pitampura at 57 kmph, Narayana at 50 kmph and Najafgarh at 40 kmph. https:\/\/twitter.com\/Indiametdept\/status\/1788977154069348502 IMD issues rain alert Meanwhile, the IMD has issued rain alert and cautioned people to stay indoors. "Impact expected over Delhi-NCR and adjoining areas due to duststorm: Strong winds may damage plantation, horticulture and standing crops. Partial damage to vulnerable structures due to strong winds. Minor damage to kutcha houses\/walls and huts. Loose objects may fly," stated the IMD in a post on X. https:\/\/twitter.com\/Indiametdept\/status\/1788971546423255321 Earlier, the IMD had forecasted gusty winds with speed of 50-70 km along with dust storm and rain for Delhi and its neighbouring cities for May 10. "Dust storm\/thunderstorm with rain (followed by rain) and gusty winds with speed of 50-70 Km\/h would occur over and adjoining areas of entire Delhi and NCR ( Loni Dehat, Hindon AF Station, Ghaziabad, Indirapuram, Chhapraula, Noida, Dadri, Greater Noida, Gurugram, Faridabad, Manesar, Ballabhgarh) ,Gohana, Gannaur, Sonipat, Rohtak, Kharkhoda (Haryana) Baraut, Bagpat, Khekra (U.P.) . Light intensity rain\/drizzle would occur over and adjoining areas of Kaithal, Narwana, Rajaund, Assandh, Safidon, Barwala, Jind, Hissar, Hansi, Siwani, Meham, Tosham (Haryana) during next 2 hours," stated the IMD. https:\/\/twitter.com\/Indiametdept\/status\/1788969274381414895 Forecast for other states The IMD had predicted heavy rains in many states of the country including Delhi-NCR from May 9 to 13. The weather department said that the mercury may fall due to rain in North India. Similar weather changes are expected in Uttar Pradesh, Delhi, Bihar, Gujarat and Maharashtra in the next five days.

author: people.com
title: Porsche's gamble to race cars using carbon neutral fuel
text:
Autocar articles Porsche's gamble to race cars using carbon neutral fuel Read full article Jesse Crosse July 5, 2024 at 11:00 AM ¬∑ 3 min read Porsche e fuels
The fuel is created by synthesising renewable hydrogen made from electrolysis using wind-generated electricity
Cars competing in this year‚Äôs Porsche Mobil 1 Supercup series will run on fuel that Porsche describes as ‚Äúnear carbon-neutral‚Äù.
The fuel is produced at the Haru Oni plant in Chile and created by synthesising renewable hydrogen made from electrolysis using wind-generated electricity. The CO2 also used to make the e-fuel comes from bio sources, although in future it will come from direct air capture (DAC).
The series has been run since 2021 using a second-generation, bio-based, partially synthetic fuel, but this year‚Äôs trial will be a first for the fully synthetic renewable fuel in its pure form.
ADVERTISEMENT Unlike production Porsches, the ECUs of which all share a stock engine map, the race cars‚Äô ECUs are mapped manually, and Porsche says they have been programmed to suit the renewable fuel. The Supercup cars haven‚Äôt needed any other mechanical modifications.
Porsche describes its fuel as ‚Äúnear‚Äù carbon-neutral, but to be strictly accurate, aside from secondary CO2 generation from, say, transport and other factors, the raw fuel should be about as carbon-neutral as it‚Äôs possible to get for now. So how is it made?
The Haru Oni site was chosen because it‚Äôs consistently windy all year round: a turbine there can generate far more electricity than in European locations. It‚Äôs estimated the plant‚Äôs 3.4MW turbine can run at full load for an average of 270 days per year, compared with 66 days for the same turbine in Germany. The electricity it produces is used to electrolyse water to create renewable hydrogen.
Hydrogen and CO2 are heated at high pressure over a catalyst to produce methanol. The raw methanol is distilled to reduce its water content from 36% to 4% and then fed into a reactor that bonds the carbon atoms in the methanol together to form long hydrocarbon chains, which are the raw, synthetic petrol. After more processing, the final product emerges as 93 Octane petrol; after blending with additives the octane rating is raised to a minimum of 98.
Story continues The DAC project being worked on with the wider Volkswagen Group and other partners is still at the ‚Äòproof of concept‚Äô stage. Volkswagen established it should be commercially viable to capture CO2 from the air five years ago, and it is working with partners HIF Global and MAN Energy Solutions to show it can be done. A DAC plant can be set up anywhere there‚Äôs a source of renewable electricity.
The Porsche Mobil 1 Supercup series runs as part of the support programme at eight Formula 1 races this year, with the first being at Imola earlier this month. It‚Äôs predicted the 32 Cup cars will consume 50,000 litres of the renewable fuel during the season.
In comparison, the planned maximum annual output of the Haru Oni plant, which began producing at scale in 2022, is 130,000 litres. Porsche sees e-fuels as complementary to ramping up its share of electric cars , and it is still aiming at a global production mix of 80% pure-electric cars by 2030 as long as there‚Äôs demand for them.
]]>

text:

A su vez, para el sur y oeste de la provincia de Buenos Aires , centro y norte de La Pampa , sur de C√≥rdoba y casi todo San Luis tambi√©n rige una alerta amarilla por tormentas para la noche de este viernes, en donde se prev√©n tormentas de variada intensidad, algunas localmente fuertes y se espera que las mismas est√©n acompa√±adas por importante actividad el√©ctrica, ocasional ca√≠da de granizo, r√°fagas fuertes y abundante ca√≠da de agua en cortos per√≠odos.

sur de C√≥rdoba para la noche, centro y oeste de La Pampa para la noche, sureste de Mendoza para la noche, Neuqu√©n para la tarde y la noche, oeste de R√≠o Negro para la tarde y noche, centro y norte de Chubut para la tarde y noche, Tierra del Fuego para la noche.

sur de Chubut por la tarde, Santa Cruz por la tarde y noche. Los vientos ser√°n del sector oeste y sudoeste, con velocidades entre 65 y 85 km/h, y r√°fagas que pueden superar los 120 km/h .
Alerta amarilla por viento zonda Finalmente, tambi√©n hay una alerta amarilla pro viento zonda en el sureste y centro de Mendoza y centro de San Juan para la noche de este viernes, en donde se prev√©n vientos del sudoeste o sur con velocidades entre 35 y 50 km/h, y r√°fagas que pueden alcanzar los 70 km/h.
